revised_title: On the Principle of Exchange of Stabilities in Fluid Dynamics
tldr: The article presents a perturbation theorem that proves the reality of simple eigenvalues in a class of non-self-adjoint systems of differential equations. The theorem is applied to Benard convection, with constant heat sources, radiation, and specific time-dependent profiles, as well as to the instability of circular Couette flow for various gap widths. The study focuses on understanding the nature of eigenvalues and their stability in fluid dynamics problems.
